glsa.title: SWFTools: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A heap-based buffer overflow in SWFTools could result in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: SWFTools is a collection of SWF manipulation and generation utilities written by Rainer BÃ¶hme and Matthias Kramm.

description.p: Integer overflow errors in the "getPNG()" function in png.c and the "jpeg_load()" function in jpeg.c could cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PNG or JPEG file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Gentoo discontinued support for SWFTools. We recommend that users unmerge swftools:
NOTE: Users could upgrade to ">=media-gfx/swftools-0.9.1", however these packages are not currently stable.
